events.title: First Tour de France Begins
events.description: The inaugural Tour de France, one of cycling's most prestigious events, started in Paris, France.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of what would become the world's most famous and challenging bicycle race.

events.title: June 16 Soweto Uprising
events.description: Thousands of black students in Soweto, South Africa, protested against the enforcement of teaching in Afrikaans, leading to violent clashes with police.
events.significance: A key event in the fight against apartheid, bringing international attention to South Africa's racial segregation policies.

events.title: Birth of Dorothy L. Sayers
events.description: Dorothy L. Sayers, English crime writer and poet, was born.
events.significance: Renowned for creating the fictional detective Lord Peter Wimsey, her works influenced the detective fiction genre.

events.title: Battle of the Alamo Ends
events.description: The Battle of the Alamo concluded with Mexican forces defeating Texan defenders after a 13-day siege during the Texas Revolution.
events.significance: Became a symbol of resistance and helped galvanize Texan forces in their fight for independence from Mexico.

events.title: Birth of André Malraux
events.description: André Malraux, French novelist, art theorist, and Minister of Cultural Affairs, was born.
events.significance: His literary and political contributions influenced 20th-century French culture and politics.
